Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a large brown pottery ribbed vessel, the interior is spotted with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a brown slip and remains of five lines of Coptic text written in black ink, containing a receipt.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.155-157)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36342) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36342)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 205 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
Miscellaneous number: SB XVIII 13388 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
